> The diff coverage is `100%`.

[![Impacted file tree graph](https://codecov.io/gh/pandas-dev/pandas/pull/24657/graphs/tree.svg?width=650&token=eZ4WkYLtcO&height=150&src=pr)](https://codecov.io/gh/pandas-dev/pandas/pull/24657?src=pr&el=tree)

|---|---|---|

| [pandas/util/testing.py](https://codecov.io/gh/pandas-dev/pandas/pull/24657/diff?src=pr&el=tree#diff-cGFuZGFzL3V0aWwvdGVzdGluZy5weQ==) | `88% <0%> (-0.1%)` | :arrow_down: |

@jreback were your comments from 
https://github.com/pandas-dev/pandas/pull/24657#pullrequestreview-189696517 blocking for this PR? They seem out of scope for the bug fix here.

this fixes a bug but i think we ought to consider deprecating copy and making it inplace
even though i don’t like that

OK. A deprecation will take time, so fix in the meantime?

On Mon, Jan 7, 2019 at 8:51 AM Jeff Reback <notifications@github.com> wrote:

> this fixes a bug but i think we ought to consider deprecating copy and
> making it inplace
> even though i don’t like that
>
> —
> You are receiving this because you commented.
> Reply to this email directly, view it on GitHub
> <https://github.com/pandas-dev/pandas/pull/24657#issuecomment-451959299>,
> or mute the thread
> <https://github.com/notifications/unsubscribe-auth/ABQHImeM5kkllqona7QG9q0Ocd22PFoqks5vA17sgaJpZM4Zy727>
> .
>

Well the order of operations could be:

1) Fix this bug first
2) Follow up PR with deprecating `copy` kwarg in `tz_convert` (or vice versa)?
Thanks! Made https://github.com/pandas-dev/pandas/issues/24667 as a follow up to deprecate `copy` in favor of `inplace`
